required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cervical Laminoplasty Versus Laminectomy and Fusion: the Long-term Results Comparison
clinical_study.official_title: Cervical Laminoplasty Versus Laminectomy and Fusion: the Long-term Results Comparison

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to retrospectively analyze and compare the long-term clinical and radiographic results of multi-level laminoplasty to multi-level laminectomy and fusion for the treatment of patients with cervical myelopathy or myeloradiculopathy.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Japanese Orthopaedic Association Score (JOA)
primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 12 months post-treatment and through study completion, an average of 10 year
primary_outcome.description: Total score 0-17. The lower the score the more severe the deficits.

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 12 months post-treatment and through study completion, an average of 10 year
primary_outcome.description: Ranging from 0%-100%. A higher score indicates more patient-rated disability.

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 12 months post-treatment and through study completion, an average of 10 year
primary_outcome.description: Measured by lateral X-Ray image. The change of lordosis was calculated and compared.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 10 year
primary_outcome.description: Any reoperation involving the same segments or adjacent segments will be calculated.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Pain Scores on the Visual Analog Scale (VAS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 12 months post-treatment and through study completion, an average of 10 year
secondary_outcome.description: Ranging from 0-10. A higher score indicates more severe pain.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, 12 months post-treatment and through study completion, an average of 10 year
through study completion, an average of 10 year
secondary_outcome.description: Any complications related to surgery will be recorded.

arm_group.description: Patients who underwent cervical laminoplasty surgery due to myelopathy.
Patients who underwent cervical laminectomy and fusion surgery due to myelopathy.

intervention.description: The posterior standard cervical laminoplasty procedure with ARCH mini-plate fixation
The posterior standard cervical laminectomy and fusion surgery procedure with lateral mass screws fixation

study_pop.textblock: Patients who underwent cervical laminoplasty or laminectomy and fusion surgery due to degenerative cervical myelopathy in our hospital from January 1, 2005 to January 1, 2015 were screened and included according to the eligibility criteria.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients aged at least 18 years
- The patient has the diagnosis of degenerative cervical myelopathy
- The myelopathy or myeloradiculopathy requires a posterior cervical decompression of the spinal canal involving two or more contiguous intervertebral levels including and between C3 and C7
- More than five years of follow-up time
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of primary focal anterior compression of the cervical spinal cord
- Previous surgery of the cervical spine
- Tumor, infection, or trauma of the cervical spine or cord
- Patients with ankylosing spondylitis
- Patients with neurodegenerative diseases, or any neuropathies
